nodes.label: Networks and Network Security
nodes.title: Networks and Network Security:

nodes.label: Computer Networks and the Internet
nodes.title: Computer Networks and the Internet:

nodes.label: Internet introduction
nodes.title: Internet introduction:

nodes.label: The Internet
nodes.title: The Internet: Internet Introduction: An overview of the Internet, a global network connecting billions of devices worldwide.

nodes.label: HTTP
nodes.title: HTTP: HTTP: The protocol used for transferring hypertext documents on the World Wide Web, defining how web browsers and servers communicate to retrieve and display web pages.

nodes.label: Application layer
nodes.title: Application layer:

nodes.label: DNS
nodes.title: DNS:

nodes.label: DNS introduction
nodes.title: DNS introduction: DNS Introduction: An overview of the Domain Name System (DNS), a hierarchical naming system for translating domain names into IP addresses.

nodes.label: DNS records
nodes.title: DNS records: DNS Records: Different types of DNS records, such as A records (address records), CNAME records (canonical name records), MX records (mail exchange records), and TXT records (text records), each serving a specific purpose within the DNS infrastructure.

nodes.label: DNS security
nodes.title: DNS security: DNS Security: Measures and protocols implemented to enhance the security of the DNS, including DNSSEC (DNS Security Extensions) for data integrity and authentication, DNS filtering to prevent malicious activities, and DNS over HTTPS (DoH) or DNS over TLS (DoT) for encrypted DNS communications.

nodes.label: Network Layer
nodes.title: Network Layer:

nodes.label: Basic features of the routing control plane
nodes.title: Basic features of the routing control plane: Routing Control Plane: Manages the exchange of routing information between routers to establish optimal paths for data packets.

nodes.label: Addressing and routing
nodes.title: Addressing and routing: Addressing and Routing: Involves assigning unique IP addresses to devices and using routing protocols to direct packets to their destinations based on these addresses.

nodes.label: Web Technology
nodes.title: Web Technology:

nodes.label: World Wide Web basics
nodes.title: World Wide Web basics:

nodes.label: HTTP and other protocols
nodes.title: HTTP and other protocols: HTTP, HTTPS, FTP, SMTP

nodes.label: DNS and domain names
nodes.title: DNS and domain names: DNS (Domain Name System): A hierarchical decentralized naming system for computers, services, or any resource connected to the internet or a private network. Domain names: Human-readable names used to identify websites and other resources on the internet, typically consisting of a series of labels separated by dots.

nodes.label: IP addresses and network devices
nodes.title: IP addresses and network devices: IP addresses: Numeric labels assigned to devices connected to a computer network that uses the Internet Protocol for communication. Network devices: Hardware devices such as routers, switches, and modems that facilitate communication between devices on a computer network.

nodes.label: Web Application Security
nodes.title: Web Application Security:

nodes.label: Security foundations and Internet security
nodes.title: Security foundations and Internet security: Understanding foundational security principles, such as confidentiality, integrity, and availability (CIA triad), and applying security measures to protect against threats on the Internet.

nodes.label: VPN,DNS security
nodes.title: VPN,DNS security: Using Virtual Private Networks (VPNs) to establish secure, encrypted connections over untrusted networks, and implementing DNS security measures, such as DNSSEC (Domain Name System Security Extensions)

nodes.label: DNS attacks
nodes.title: DNS attacks: Understanding common DNS attacks such as DNS spoofing, DNS amplification attacks, and DNS tunneling, and implementing countermeasures to protect DNS infrastructure and ensure the integrity of DNS resolution.
